bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 165, Number 155 (Wednesday, September 25, 2019)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Ms. NORTON:H.R. 4493.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:clause 18 of section 8 of article I of the Constitution.[Page H7990]

item.text: Referred to the House Committee on Oversight and Reform.
Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR E1205)

item.name: Government employee pay, benefits, personnel management

summary.text:
Federal Employee Short-Term Disability Insurance Act of 2019

This bill requires the Office of Personnel Management to establish and administer a short-term disability insurance program for federal employees who suffer a non-work related injury or disability, take leave to care for a family member, or take leave to adopt a child or become a foster parent.

bill.title: Federal Employee Short-Term Disability Insurance Act of 2019

item.title: Federal Employee Short-Term Disability Insurance Act of 2019
To provide a short-term disability insurance program for Federal employees for disabilities that are not work-related, and for other purposes.
Federal Employee Short-Term Disability Insurance Act of 2019

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Oversight and Reform.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
